page.title: 10Linwood and Johnstone
page.content: {Linwood}is a small town on the outskirts of{Paisley}in the{ {Strathclyde Region.}The name Linwood means{"Sheltered Neuk","Wooded Area". There has been a village for many hundreds of years,but Linwood has now grown quite large.Many people came to Linwood in the past to work in the cotton mill,the paper mill and the many mines here.More recently people came to work in the car factory and to find housing when nearby{Glasgow} became overcrowded.Unfortunately the car plant has since closed and there is now a lot of local unemployment. Neighbouring{Johnstone}is another small town.A famous son from{Elderslie in Johnstone was{William Wallace,}who led the Scots in the{Scottish Wars of {Independence.}Johnstone today is a busy and thriving place.
